replies.msg:
Hi there, Catch22 here. First of all, big shout out to all the people who’re fighting persistently during this hard times, it ‘s not been easy but we’re trying to do our best saving our beautiful HK, for that, you guys have my respect and I’m tremendously proud of us being HK people and the way we fight and how many that we achieved.
So let me introduce myself a little, basically I ‘m a guy who want to something for HK and trying to make a difference, just like everybody else who truly love HK. We live here, loving here, And hopefully we will be having our last breath here in our homeland. ( Well, naturally , I mean, by the way, just don’t grill me for this )Or maybe you just care about HK, human beings or the world, welcome!
What am I gonna do or trying to say is that I’m gonna do some translating works here which I believe we ‘re talking about Cantonese, the language we use to the English language and the the written from Chinese ( Yes, Cantonese is beautiful language that not that easy to nail down if you ain’t a native speaker but hey welcome,if you are really into this language or culture, be patient, I ensure this is a fascinating language especially when you are about in the upper intermediate leveler so), that pretty much it.
I am by no means a pro as to translating but I am pretty confident that our posts here will be accurately translated and words get spread out. Sure enough, I make mistakes and I will be but hope you guys won’t mind because I’m no expert in translating, I do not have a degree for this, I’m just a volunteer who wanna do something for HK and out LIHKG community.
Thank you for the reading, I’d say keep up the work we’re doing and you guys have any suggestions in this subject matter, let me know by comment down below, thank you.

As we always say,
“Liberate HK, the revolution of our times!”
